moves.3... Nf6: The berlin.My favorite defense against the Ruy.
moves.4. d3: A quiet move that doesn't really promise White an advantage
moves.9. Bg3 Nh5: Looking to gain the two Bishops.
moves.13. Bc4 Qf6: Dogpile on the knight on f3!
moves.14. c3 Nxf3+ 15. Nxf3 Bxf3 16. Qxf3 Qxf3: I look to attack the weak doubled pawns in the future.
moves.17... c6 18. b4 Bb6 19. a4 a6: This move is not necessary but I like the Bishop's chances on the g1-a7 diagonal
moves.20... Ba7 21. Kg2 Kh7: Looking to maneuver the rook on the  open g-file
moves.22. Rfh1 f5 23. exf5: This seems to me a bit of an concession.
moves.27. Bb3 d5: Black has great control over the center and a better position.
moves.28. Bc2: looking for discovery tricks on the b1-h7 diagonal.
moves.28... Rg8+ 29. Kf1 Rxf3: Not fearing 30.d4+ e4 and threatening Rxf2#
moves.30. Rh2 Rgf8: Black bears all his pieces on the f2 pawn.
moves.31. Re2 Rf8f6 32. Rg2 Be3 33. Ke1 Bc1: I have to admit I did not see that the pawn was hanging bt Black should regain it back anyway.
moves.34. Rxe5 Bb2 35. Re7+ Rf6f7 36. Rxf7+ Rx: ?! this loses two pawns instead of one with 38.cxd4 Bxd4 when the f2 pawn must fall since 39.Ke2 loses the queenside pawns after 39...Bc3
moves.38... Bc3+ 39. Ke2 Bxb4 40. Rg4 c5 41. f: Black now has two extra pawns,but he should win.
moves.44. Bb3 Rg7: ?A mistake,White should trade rooks and have good chances of drawing the Opposite color Bishop endgme.
moves.45. f5: ? for the note to Black's 44th move.
moves.45... Rxg4: ? Same as above,Black should not trade rooks.
moves.46. Kxg4 Kg7 47. Kf4 Kf6 48. Be6 Bd2+ 49: Black is trying to march the h-pawn down,to no avail of course.
moves.59... Ke5 60. Kf3 Bg5 61. Ke2 Kf4 62. Kf: I offered the draw knowing that I can't win the endgame.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C65), Berlin defence, Kaufmann variation
